data.title: Glen Powell and His Pup Take ‘Twisters’ Premiere, ‘Fly Me to the Moon’ Launches and This Week’s Best Events
data.meta_description: Inside this week's biggest Hollywood premieres, parties and openings, including events for 'Twisters' and 'Fly Me to the Moon.'
data.text:
Here’s a look at this week’s biggest premieres, parties and openings in Los Angeles and New York, including events for Twisters, Fly Me to the Moon and Longlegs.

Fly Me to the Moon premiere

Scarlett Johansson and Channing Tatum walked the carpet on Monday at the New York premiere of their rom-com, set against the backdrop of the Apollo 11 moon landing.

Twisters premiere

Stars Daisy Edgar-Jones, Glen Powell and Anthony Ramos joined director Lee Isaac Chung at the Los Angeles premiere of their new disaster movie on Thursday, with support from Powell’s dog Brisket.

Lady in the Lake premiere

Natalie Portman and Moses Ingram debuted their new Apple TV+ series in New York on Thursday.

Cinespia Charlie’s Angels and Shrek 2 screenings

Cinespia celebrated the Fourth of July holiday with screenings of Charlie’s Angels and Shrek 2 at Hollywood Forever Cemetery, with guests including Lili Reinhart, Kaitlyn Dever, Este Haim, Danielle Haim and Alana Haim.

The h.wood Group’s 10th Annual Red, White & Bootsy

L.A. hotspot Bootsy Bellows returned to Nobu Malibu for its 10th annual Fourth of July party, presented by LF*GO! Energy, this year featuring surprise performances by Wiz Khalifa and Mario.

Divorce in the Black premiere

Writer-director Tyler Perry joined stars Meagan Good, Cory Hardrict, Taylor Polidore, Richard Lawson, Debbi Morgan, Shannon Wallace and Joseph Lee Anderson at the NYC premiere of their Prime Video film on Monday.

Longlegs premiere

Nicolas Cage, Maika Monroe, Blair Underwood, Alicia Witt and writer-director Osgood Perkins debuted their serial killer horror film in L.A. on Monday.

Receiver premiere

Executive producer Peyton Manning joined NFL stars George Kittle, Davante Adams, Justin Jefferson and Amon-Ra St. Brown at the premiere of Netflix’s Receiver series on Tuesday.

David Yurman special event

Teyana Taylor, Chase Stokes, Drew Starkey and Chris Appleton were among the stars who celebrated the launch of David Yurman’s new men’s campaign and three-part docuseries featuring new global ambassadors and NBA players Kyle Kuzma, D’Angelo Russell and Jalen Green on Tuesday.

Uninterrupted Film Festival

The two-day event celebrating athletes as storytellers, powered by Tribeca Festival, featured conversations with Paul George, Lil Dicky, Matt Barnes, Trae Young and Omari Hardwick, and concluded with the world premiere of the HBO documentary Charlie Hustle & the Matter of Pete Rose.

Sausage Party: Foodtopia premiere

Seth Rogen, Kristen Wiig and Sam Richardson walked the carpet at the premiere of their new Sausage Party animated series on Wednesday.

Descendants: The Rise of Red premiere

Disney+ celebrated the world premiere of the Disney original movie Descendants: The Rise of Red with stars Kylie Cantrall, Malia Baker, Rita Ora and Brandy on Wednesday, where the cast of Wizards Beyond Waverly Place also made an appearance.

Athleta Power of She Luncheon

Athleta hosted the inaugural Power of She Luncheon in Beverly Hills on Wednesday, co-hosted by Sophia Bush and ESPN’s Ari Chambers to highlight nominees for the ESPYs Best College Athlete Women’s Sports award.

Watershed premiere

Watershed premiered in L.A. on Wednesday with support from Billie Lourd and her husband, executive producer Austen Rydell. The documentary is co-directed by five-time Paralympic medalist Mallory Weggemann and her husband Jay Snyder about Weggemann’s journey to the Tokyo Paralympics.

America’s Burning screening

Executive producer Michael Douglas attended a special NYC screening of the film alongside his children on Wednesday.

It’s Good Dinner

It’s Good, the invite-only restaurant discovery and list-keeping app founded by John Legend and Mike Rosenthal, hosted an immersive dinner experience on Wednesday at the Flamingo Estate in L.A., with guests including Chrissy Teigen, Jen Atkin, Shay Mitchell, Jesse Tyler Ferguson, Desi Perkins and Aimee Song.

Sing Sing special screening

Regina King hosted a special screening for A24’s Sing Sing on Thursday, with stars Colman Domingo, Clarence “Divine Eye” Maclin, Sean San José and Paul Raci.

My Spy The Eternal City special screening

Castmembers Ken Jeong, Anna Faris, Chloe Coleman, Kristen Schaal, Flula Borg, Taeho K and director Pete Segal walked the carpet at a special screening of the My Spy sequel on Thursday.

Saks Summer Soirée

Saks CEO Marc Metrick and Dakota Fanning hosted an intimate dinner party at the Sag Harbor Tavern in the Hamptons on Thursday to celebrate the summer season with designers, friends of the brand and top clients.

ACC Golf Championship

The ACC Golf Championship presented by American Century Investments returned to South Lake Tahoe this week, welcoming its typically star-studded lineup of players, including Travis and Jason Kelce, Aaron Rodgers, Miles Teller, Don Cheadle, Tony Romo, Rob McElhenney and Bobby Flay.

Audi x Inter Miami CF celebration

Audi of America and Inter Miami CF celebrated in Miami on Thursday following their partnership announcement, making Audi the official premium automotive partner of the club. Guests included Diego Calva and Inter Miami CF players Julian Dressel, Ian Fray and Cole Jensen.

“The Art & Practice of Sound Design” workshop

Robert Ivison, A.C.E., editing discipline head at the AFI Conservatory, and Oscar-winning sound designer and editor Richard King attended the launch of new workshop “The Art & Practice of Sound Design” on the AFI Conservatory campus.

Gracemoon Arts Theatre Opening Night Gala

The Gracemoon Arts Company, founded by acting coach Michèle Lonsdale Smith, held the opening night gala for its new theatre in Brooklyn on Thursday, with appearances from actors Amrit Kaur, Marsha Stephanie Blake and Hamza Haq.
